    Influence curves and the Hodges-Lehman Estimator

    This example implements example 5 of Stefanski and Boos (2002).

    \[ \psi(Y^2_i, \theta) = \begin{pmatrix} IC_{\hat{\theta}_{HL}}(Y^2; \theta_0) - (\theta_1 - \theta_0) \\ \end{pmatrix} \]

    The functions used in SB5_eefun are defined below:

    F0 <- function(y, theta0, distrFUN = pnorm){
  distrFUN(y - theta0, mean = 0)
}

f0 <- function(y, densFUN){
  densFUN(y, mean = 0)
}

integrand <- function(y, densFUN = dnorm){
  f0(y, densFUN = densFUN)^2
}

IC_denom <- integrate(integrand, lower = -Inf, upper = Inf)$value
    SB5_eefun <- function(data){
  Yi <- data$Y2
  function(theta){
     (1/IC_denom) * (F0(Yi, theta[1]) - 0.5)
  }
}
    estimates <- estimate_equations(
  eeFUN = SB5_eefun, 
  data  = geexex,
  roots = c(2))

    The hc.loc of the ICSNP package computes the Hodges-Lehman estimator and SB gave closed form estimators for the variance.

    theta_cls <- ICSNP::hl.loc(geexex$Y2)
Sigma_cls <- 1/(12 * IC_denom^2) / nrow(geexex)
    ## $geex
## $geex$parameters
## [1] 2.026376
## 
## $geex$vcov
##            [,1]
## [1,] 0.01040586
##
